Reviews.Title: 4MB Cache and 6GB memory make this a winner
Reviews.Author: Andrea Polk
Reviews.Content: Big 17" backlit LED screen, huge 750GB hard drive, 6GB of memory and a 4MB L2 cache, with all the ports you need, make this a great buy for about four hundred bucks.  No, it's not an Intel processor, but AMD quad cores give solid performance, especially when combined with a relatively large cache and memory.  The 1.9 GHz A-Series Quad-Core A8 processor does a fine job and offers speedy performance using Windows 8 64-bit as an operating system.Yes, Windows 8 isn't a favorite, but get a book like Windows 8.1 For Dummies, and upgrade to Windows 8.1 (on the Microsoft site) for free out of the box, and you'll find a 'happy place' that's stable and useful on this PC.The maximum supported memory on this laptop is 8GB.  I would have liked to see it at something like 16GB, but at this budget end of the laptop spectrum, that's rare. I would have also liked a backlit keyboard, but that too is rare and not necessary, just nice to have. Bluetooth is also lacking on this PC, but you can easily solve that problem by adding one of these: Kinivo BTD-400 Bluetooth 4.0 USB adapter - For Windows 8 / Windows 7 / Vista, which works well.  It does take up a USB port, but by adding a Sabrent Premium 4 Port Aluminum USB Hub (9.5" cable) for iMac, MacBook, MacBook Pro, MacBook Air, Mac Mini, or any PC (HB-UMAC) you solve the 'lack of USB issue' with a fairly portable, small device.The AMD Radeon HD 7640G graphics look good on this 17.3" display (1600 x 900). Movies streamed via Netfix or played on the DVD burner, look good and the DTS integrated sound is adequate, but can be enjoyed more fully by the addition of wired headphones or Bluetooth headsets (when optional Bluetooth USB adapter is installed).  This is NOT a touchscreen laptop.There's a full-sized keyboard with numeric keypad, and touchpad that supports multi-gestures with on/off.  I find I still like to use a wireless mouse with my laptops, as touchpads can be overly sensitive or not responsive enough.  This touchpad seemed to be OK though.The ports on this laptop include: (2) USB 3.0 ports, (1) USB 2.0, VGA, HDMI, and a wired Ethernet port.  The laptop has wireless built-in, as well as an integrated HD webcam with a digital microphone.  There's also a headphone 3.5mm jack and external microphone port.At 6 pounds this is not a lightweight, highly portable laptop.  It has a 3-5 hour battery life (dependent upon type of use) and with its 17" screen is rather large to haul around. Users who plan on keeping this laptop at home; moving it room to room, will think it's a good choice, as will those looking for a desktop replacement.  Students on the go will want something more lightweight and portable, unless they really want the bigger screen.I recommend this laptop as a step above the basic budget PC.  It's build quality is very good, and despite having a slower 5400RPM hard drive, it's quite quick due to its 4MB cache, quad processor and 6GB of memory.  It's got a huge hard drive and all the ports you need to be useful for a long time.I'm not crazy about how the glossy finish picks up fingerprints, and I wish it had Bluetooth, but frankly if that's the worst I can say about it - it's pretty darn sweet!SPECS PER HP SITE:Product Name 17-e079nrProduct Number E8B77UAMicroprocessor 1.9GHz AMD Quad-Core A8-4500M Accelerated ProcessorMicroprocessor Cache 4MB L2 CacheMemory 6GB DDR3L SDRAM (2 DIMM)Memory Max Maximum supported = 8GBMemory Slots 2 user accessibleVideo Graphics AMD Radeon HD 7640G Discrete-Class graphics and up to 3182MB total graphics memoryDisplay 17.3-inch diagonal HD+ BrightView LED-backlit display (1600 x 900)Hard Drive 750GB 5400RPM hard drive with HP ProtectSmart Hard Drive ProtectionMultimedia Drive SuperMulti DVD burnerNetwork Card 10/100BASE-T Ethernet LAN (RJ-45 connector)Wireless Connectivity 1x1 802.11b/g/n WLANSound DTS Sound+Keyboard Full-size keyboard with numeric keypadPointing Device Touchpad supporting multi-touch gestures without on/off buttonExternal Ports Multi-format digital media card reader for Secure Digital cards2 SuperSpeed USB 3.01 Universal Serial Bus (USB) 2.01 HDMI1 VGA (15-pin)1 RJ-45 (LAN)1 Headphone-out/microphone-in combo jackDimensions 1.16 in (min H) / 1.29 in (max H) x 16.5 in (W) x 10.5 in (D)Weight 5.99 lbPower 65W AC adapter6-cell 47WHr 2.2 Ah lithium-ion batteryID Mech Description Front facing HP TrueVision HD Webcam with integrated digital microphone

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop for the price.
Reviews.Author: budders
Reviews.Content: Bought this on black friday for $369.99. So far it's been a pretty nice laptop. It's quicker then I expected, and it can run games like bf4 with everything on low at 30fps. It keeps up with my amd 8350 as far as basic tasks like web browsing and word documents go. Also seems to be fairly sturdy, but i guess only time will tell. My only con would be the viewing angles on the screen. If you tilt the screen back quite a ways its nice, but if your viewing it like a normal laptop the colors can get kinda washed out.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: 4mytink
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my mom for Christmas.  She loves it.  Screen is big enough for her to see clearly. Lightweight to be carried from room to room. Speed was great for what she uses it for.  No gaming or movies or anything like that.  Just a simple computer to pay her bills and look up on the internet.  Set up was very easy.  Still trying to get her to get the hang of Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: HP Computer is a hit!
Reviews.Author: Dianne's Narratives
Reviews.Content: This computer was a Christmas gift for a young man....age 16.  So far he is very happy with it...and was very delighted to receive it.

Reviews.Title: Great value, but
Reviews.Author: Nat Harris
Reviews.Content: This was a great value but the windows 8 and size scared my wife to death and she wouldn't even try to use it. I ended up formatting her laptop with XP and installing a full clean version of Windows 7 with more RAM of Windows Home PRO edition and her favorite software and personal stuff and she thinks it is brand new and super cool.  Windows 8 was just too much for her to switch up to.

Reviews.Title: HP 17" Laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this laptop and use it everyday... Still getting use to the new 8.1 version because it offers so much.. Also much lighter then my old 17" Gateway... Very happy with this new laptop....

Reviews.Title: Love the computer, hate Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Mikel R. Berry "Storm Rider"
Reviews.Content: I've always liked HP products. I'm a computer specialist with DHS and have worked with nearly every make and model of laptop out there. Even iPads (hate them). This Pavilion does everything I expected it to do, with all of the equipment built into it. AMD makes a great quad-core processor. The video card (I use Skype quite a bit) is exceptional. The laptop is great.Now, I need to go buy 'Windows 8 for Dummies'. The Federal Government is using this yet. But, by the time Windows 27.5 is out, we will be. So, I am ahead of the rest of my peers. At least in the frustration department. Thank God and Microsoft you can still access your traditional active desktop.

Reviews.Title: great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: drragonlv
Reviews.Content: this has been a great laptop. its pretty fast for the price. I love everything about it. would buy it again no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion
Reviews.Author: Joanne
Reviews.Content: Bought it for husband as a Christmas present.  He thinks its great. Loves the size of the screen.  A lot of nice features.

Reviews.Title: Good Middle-of-the Road Laptop.
Reviews.Author: Efree
Reviews.Content: This laptop is good for most of us who do everyday computing. This laptop has a good processor, not the best, but I do not need to pay a hundred or a few hundred dollars more for performance that I will never use. The laptop comes with ample storage and a lot of memory. Windows 8 takes a little getting used to, even with 8.1, but so did Vista and Windows 7 compared to Windows XP. Windows 8.1 is very customizable and you can have it start at the desktop if you prefer that over the Start page with the Apps/ tiles. A good buy!

Reviews.Title: Great value with performance
Reviews.Author: Aaron S. Ross
Reviews.Content: While Windows 8 takes some getting used to, it is very fast and efficient.  Laptop is everything I expected, great price for the amount of RAM and storage!  Battery life if great so far, I've streamed several movies with no buffering or hiccups.

Reviews.Title: works well but too large and heavy
Reviews.Author: Momodou Bah
Reviews.Content: Good functionality. In the world of ''air'' this product is heavy and bulky. The overall product experience is not bad.

Reviews.Title: Good hardware bad softwrae
Reviews.Author: E. F. Lopez
Reviews.Content: this is a pretty good computer,honestly i dont care about touchscreen,it was a pain in the ......... to be able to format it and install windows 7, but honestly that fix the problem with the computer.

Reviews.Title: gaming on a budget.
Reviews.Author: William G.
Reviews.Content: For the money it's pretty good. Will even run Skyrim. Its pretty thin too for having a disc drive. I recommend to any gamer on a budget.

Reviews.Title: I hope HP will keep up with updates
Reviews.Author: RAS
Reviews.Content: I have a HP Pavillion 17" that came with VISTA Windows and can only run on VISTA.  If you update to Windows 8 - you will lose the video card drivers for the NVIDIA GeForce Go 7600.  Neither, HP nor NVIDA support the video card with updates for Windows 8.  I tried the exterior USB IOGEAR Video Adapter by Display Link to counter the mess, but it too, has to have a graphic card that Windows 8 recognizes.  Other than that my HP has been great.

Reviews.Title: Pretty much love it
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: I am having a hard time learning Windows 8, but I guess that will come with time.  Wish they would stop changing the O/S.

Reviews.Title: Reason for poor rating
Reviews.Author: David Bass
Reviews.Content: The computer it self is fine. however the Windows 8 program that Hewlett Packard loaded onto it is perhaps the worst Windows I have ever had the misfortune of being forced to put up with in a word it is DREADFUL!

Reviews.Title: HP anodized Silver and Black HP Pavilion
Reviews.Author: Nathan Zeringue
Reviews.Content: When I ordered the hp laptop....I thought I had specified windows 7.  Instead, I got windows 8 which I do not like at all.  It is a whole new learning process and it is not what I wanted.  But, I guess I am stuck with it.  Next time....I will be more thorough in the detail of the product I order.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: JAMES HOFACKER
Reviews.Content: This computer surpassed all my expectations and more . Battery life is a little longer than advertised. Memory is quite substantial. Lightening fast speed compared to windows XP. Wish screen resolution was a little bit higher.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavillion 17-e079nr 17.3 inch Laptop
Reviews.Author: Tammy Wynen
Reviews.Content: Not a bad laptop, however would have liked the option to buy it with Windows 7 instead of Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: i DON'T LIKE WINDOWS 8
Reviews.Author: D. Sherek
Reviews.Content: The computer is ok, but I don't like windows 8.  There is nothing the same as 7, and is a complete learning process, wasting time that I could be using doing my work.

Reviews.Title: Computer Great, Windows 8.....eh
Reviews.Author: sandra tabit
Reviews.Content: I love the HP laptop itself. It works great! Windows 8 takes a lot of getting used to. It was very frustrating at first, but don't give up too early! I have come to really like Windows 8 and I love the laptop as well. Definitely would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8.1
Reviews.Author: Alan "DemanNo1"
Reviews.Content: I love the speed of the laptop......... but I hate the new Windows 8.1 format. Windows XP is just as fast and a whole lot simpler for me. I like the fact that all my tools are on one screeen, with XP, I can have my favorite places on the one screen, files, toolbars, e-mail, It is missing the AOL Desktop 9.7 screen that I am use to.If there is a way that I can have Windows XP on this new 17.3" screen Laptop, I would give the computer 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: The best you can get for the price
Reviews.Author: ailias
Reviews.Content: Got this laptop on a lightning deal for $399 and so far I love it, the 17.3 inch screen really gives you a lot of space and it's great for watching movies in HD. Keyboard has full numeric pad, which is a plus, however the keys are a bit small and spaced out so it's a bit hard to type (for me at least)...Came with windows 8 which I don't find so user-friendly for non-tablet users, but it runs fast (very fast boot too) and I haven't had any errors nor the typical blue screen of death yet. I've found that it updates constantly, so rebooting for installing those updates becomes a bit teadious since it delays startup/shutdown process(of course you can always tweak your windows update options and choose not to install updates at all)...The battery lasts for about 3 hours using High Performance settings if watching a movie (got to watch 3 episodes in HD of Breaking Bad in a row with some pauses till it asked me to charge it), playing a game lasts about the same, so I suppose with not so many process running and battery saver settings it can well last up to 5 hours give or take...Anyway, I feel comfortable with this purchase, money well spent so I fully recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It doesnt look as cool as much more expensive laptops, but my kids dont know the difference.  It plays the kinds of games my kids play (wow and minecraft) very well.  I am very happy with this laptop

Reviews.Title: Not So Good!!
Reviews.Author: Patrick J Eversden
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 is no improvment from 7.Games are hard to access. Greed seems to be a factor.Touch pad frequently doesn't move the curser.

Reviews.Title: It was just what I needed.
Reviews.Author: Lisa A Tiani
Reviews.Content: Bought this for work and It is just what i needed. It can handle all the tasks I need. And the price poiint was great

Reviews.Title: Kids where very happy !!!
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Carroll
Reviews.Content: The only thing is that it takes a bit for a movie to come up .. But it's great thank you for making our christmas special ..

Reviews.Title: Hp pavilion
Reviews.Author: Jeremiah M.
Reviews.Content: I like the computer however I DO NOT LIKE windows 8. It is not user friendly by any means. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: This is the first computer I had with Windows 8 on it and it is quite different than Windows 7, but it is easy to convert from Windows 7 to 8.

Reviews.Title: Great PC, Arrived as scheduled, Windows 8 upgrade worked fine
Reviews.Author: TerryD
Reviews.Content: Only problem I have had is getting used to Windows 8.1.  If you aren't used to the new windows I recommend waiting until you have a week or two to get used to it before you upgrade.  I works great on the shipped operating system, and seems to be working fine on the new 8.1 now that I am better aquainted with it.

Reviews.Title: Loved the PC, hated the Operating software
Reviews.Author: Sheri
Reviews.Content: When HP sells a computer with an operating software that has changed so much that you have no idea where to start, it really should come with a manual or the option to go back to Windows 7.0.

Reviews.Title: Computer
Reviews.Author: Jerrie
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, there were a bunch of things not operating correctly on the laptop and right now it is on its way back to you.  It was either return it or put it in a computer shop as my computer savy friends and I were not able to correct them.  I loved the computer itself - it was fast and nice keyboard and after 14 days of beating our heads against the wall and my friends avoiding me since my conversation was nothing but HELP, I decided to return it.  Obviously not smart enough to deal with the problems.

Reviews.Title: I cannot update to Windows 8.1
Reviews.Author: W. Caylor
Reviews.Content: The internet is so f-ing slow, and all my attempts to follow HP's instructions to update to 8.1 (Hoping the update will improve internet speed) have failed .

Reviews.Title: Okay, but slow machine!
Reviews.Author: Talon Jensen "stargazer"
Reviews.Content: I don't have this laptop, but the other review I read on it seems crazy positive!The CPU for this laptop is most likely the AMD A8-4500M which comes in at a pokey 92nd fastest laptop CPU on cpubenchmark's website (dot net). The other review talks up the "large" L2 cache, which is a cache in the very slow CPU and won't really do much to make up for the slow CPU (92nd in laptop CPUs!).It is probably okay for surfing the web and some minor applications but don't ever think you are going to edit large graphic files or videos without major slowdowns. That probably fits the average resolution of the screen, personally I like higher res with the ability to see more vertically, especially on a 17 inch.On the bright side the HP machines I've had were better than average build quality.
